alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:04PM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast West Virginia, including the following county, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding along the Bluestone River and other flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. The Bluestone River continues to slowly rise and is about to reach the minor flood stage of 12 feet. At this level, water begins to affect the lowest portions of Route 19 near Spanishburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM EST, River gauge reports indicated rising levels due to earlier rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Mercer County including Spanishburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
